Over the past 36 years, the Montreal Highland Games & Festival has become one of the premier events on the North American highland games circuit. The Montreal Highland Games is always held on the Sunday following the Maxville Games which makes it a double header for pipe bands, athletes, highland dancers and spectators. (Among competitors this has become known as the M&M weekend.)

NEW LOCATION THIS YEAR!

1382566705352635.description:
(English to follow)

♥♥♥ La Soirée des Slows, Que des slows, toute la nuit ♥♥♥

Dôtée de danseurs designés pour tous les timides, et d’un carnet de chansons si vous souhaitez planifier des slows à l’avance, la Soirée des Slows a toutes les bonnes chansons, toute la nuit.

C’est comme au bal de graduation, sauf que ca finira bien, de plus les queers, personnes ainés et couples sont les bienvenus.

PS : ensembles inspirés et inspirants de rigueur mais pas obligatoires.


Vendredi 04 avril 2014
Mainline Theatre
3997 Boulevard Saint Laurent
(Juste au sud de Duluth côté Est)

Portes à 21h30, slows de 22h à 3h

Admission de $10 incluant le carnet de slows, mais la carnet est seulement en anglais, désolé

Remarque sur les cartes des slows: les cartes de slows sont ces petits carnets qui contiennent les listes des chansons qui seront jouées à cette soirée. Elles vous permettront de réserver des slows tous au long de la soirée avec vos personnes favorites et vice versa. Alors quand votre charmante hôtesse annoncera la chanson, vous n’aurez qu’à consulter votre carnet et danser avec le/la heureuse élue. Il y a un petit espace après chaque chanson où les personnes peuvent écrire les noms. Rendez-vous au kiosk des carnets et munissez des petits crayons à votre disponibilité. Plus d’espace a été prévus afin que vous puissiez aussi écrire les noms et numéros de cell des charmantes personnes avec qui vous aurez dansé à cette soirée.

Remarque sur les danseurs accompagnateurs : les soirées seront toujours dotées de danseurs accompagnateurs qui vous entraîneront dans les slows. Ils seront vêtus de banderoles dorées qui accentuent leur côté chaleureux et charmant, ils vous aideront à vous sentir à l’aise. Bien entendu les remarques sur le comportement s’appliquent aussi aux danseurs accompagnateurs, eux aussi peuvent refuser une offre ou choisir de ne pas re-danser avec vous, mais il est très possible qu’ils le fassent tout de même. Imaginez-les comme des sauveteurs, qui viendrait vous chercher si vous vous noyez ou mieux encore, comme la lumière d’un phare qui vous rappelle à la terre ferme, bon ok c’est un peu exagéré. Mais ils sont là pour vous rassurer quoi qu’il arrive!

***

You are cordially invited to ♥♥♥ MONTREAL QUEER SLOWDANCE! ♥♥♥

Fling yourself into Spring!

With a lending library of designated dancers for all you wallflowers, and a dancecard-booklet to set up dances in advance (should you choose to) Montreal Queer Slowdance has all slow songs, all night long! (Except for the occasional intermission when we play the fastest songs we can find!)

It's high school with a happy ending! Come and experience why slow is beautiful, and why love is not ironic. Come Sway-It-Forward.

PS. Fabulous and inspired attire, while desired, is not required. You do not have to be queer to attend this party, but it helps, and you must have an open mind, an open heart, and open arms.

We are always looking for Designated Dancers for our evenings, whose job it is to ask folks to dance, and to turn wallflowers into perennials. If you are outgoing, warm, compassionate and gregarious and this appeals to you - please contact the organizers at inconsolablecat@hotmail.com and we will send you more info about your possible role.

To be alerted to ♥♥♥ FUTURE EVENTS ♥♥♥ in your area, please sign-up to our EMAIL LIST: http://eepurl.com/QHnpb  We promise not to spam you. We hate that sort of thing too! Likely it'll be one email per month letting you know what events are happening soon.

★★★

Mainline Theatre
3997 Blvd. St-Laurent
(Just south of Duluth - look for the sign with flames painted on it!)

Friday, April 4, 2014
Doors at 9:30, Dance from 10 PM - 3 AM.
$10 admission includes your Dancecard-booklet!
Regretfully, the Mainline Theatre is not wheelchair-accessible.
18+ (as alcohol will be available for purchase)

★★★

"Relive the prom without the angst." - the Canadian Press

"In an age where physical contact is a scarce commodity, an event that brings strangers safely together is long overdue." - The Montreal Gazette

"I really like hugging people, and this is like, a five-minute hug." - Telyn Kusalik, one of our guests

★★★

♥ A NOTE ABOUT THE DANCE CARDS: The dancecards are these little booklets that contain a setlist of every song that will be played that evening. The idea is that during the course of the evening, you can "book" certain songs with certain people, and vice versa. So when your charming hosts announce a particular song, you can look on your dancecard and see who it is you're going to dance with next. There is a little space after every song where people can write their names. How filled your dancecard gets depends on you, of course. Ask someone to dance! Or give someone meaningful looks! Look for the Dancecard-Signing Station located somewhere on the premises, usually near a light, where small pencils are available. The dancecards also - thoughtfully - have lots of empty places where you can write down the names and numbers of charming people whom you may have danced with that night. Use of the dancecards, is, of course, optional, and completely up to you. Proceed at your comfort level.

♥ A NOTE ABOUT THE RULES OF ENGAGEMENT: The Rules essentially state that as someone coming to Slowdance, you have the right to ask anyone you want to dance. But whoever it is you asked has the right to refuse your request, and not have to give any reason why. But wonderfully, you have this right as well. This is done because slowdancing with someone is rather an intimate sort of enterprise, and a minor commitment, and you should have the right to back out anytime you wish. Slowdance is about consensual respect and enjoyment. Just because you may have danced with someone for most of the song, if at any point you are feeling unsafe or uncomfortable, you can simply walk away. If whoever it is persists in their attention, locate one of the organizers, and they will be ejected from the premises.

♥ A NOTE ABOUT THE DESIGNATED DANCERS: On any particular night there will be a handful of our Designated Dancers available to dance with you for the first half of the evening - so arrive early! They will be wearing glowing items over their hearts, and these Designated Dancers are warm, charming, and safe people to ask to dance. Of course, the same Rules of Engagement apply, and they, as free agents, can decide for themselves who they want to dance with, and for how long, but in all likelihood, they would be very open to dancing with you. Please think of them as a warm taxi light in the middle of a blizzard; the cast of a lighthouse, when you are too far from shore and shrouded in fog; a glimmer of hope after a lifetime of desolation. Well, actually, that might be pushing it. Please think of them as a temporary safe harbour. They will also be looking for you, and asking you to dance, trying in their way to turn any wallflowers into perennials.

♥ A NOTE ABOUT WHY WE HAVE BOTH "QUEER" AND "STRAIGHT" SLOWDANCES: So, we have both Queer and Straight Slowdances. We didn't used to. In the beginning, there was no division. It was just Slowdance. It was open to everybody. The idea was that you would meet strangers, and dance with them, and get to know them, and it wouldn't matter what their orientation was. And for awhile it worked. But sometimes when you put on an event, it becomes something you didn't anticipate. I had a girl come up to me and tell me that they were sick of all the dudes asking them to dance when they were really pining after the soft butch in the corner. I had one guy come up to me and tell me that his gaydar was off because he just kept mistakenly asking all the straight dudes to dance. We discovered that at Slowdance, as open-hearted and open-minded as the people who would come to this kind of event are, folks still have preferred genders they might prefer to ask to dance. And that's okay. We don't all have to be one happy family. We can be, instead, happy families.

♥ A NOTE ABOUT ACCESSIBILITY: Unfortunately the Mainline Theatre is not accessible. It is up quite a steep flight of about 20 steps. Additionally, the bathrooms have stalls, but they are very small.

♥ A NOTE ABOUT COMMON SCENTS: Because at this event folks will be in very close proximity to each other, pretty much hugging, we would like attendees to be mindful of what they smell like. Now, we don't want to stipulate that attendees must not wear scents, or use scented soaps or shampoos, or not smoke. One of the best thing about Slowdance is that you can choose who you would like to dance with, and we are loathe to take choices away from attendees - but if you have a habit of spraying a cologne or perfume on before leaving the house, we would ask that you consider NOT doing so. Smell the way you smell. This does not mean not bathing. We heartily encourage bathing and wearing freshly laundered clothes. But the fact is, in this culture, we often try to cover up "bad" smells by pouring on the "good" ones. We would ask that you take as much consideration regarding what you SMELL like as what you LOOK like before you leave the house. (PS. We recognize that our providing breath mints and gum is totally hypocritical here). And actually, for some chemically injured/scent-sensitive folks, this is an issue of accessibility, so we ask you to be considerate. Thank you!

♥ A NOTE ABOUT HOMOPHOBIC ARTISTS: It was recently brought to our attention that certain artists, like Bon Jovi, Guns ‘n Roses, Sting, Eminem, Ween, Public Enemy, The Pogues, The Kinks, Sex Pistols, Frank Zappa, Korn, Violent Femmes, or Chris Brown, are alleged to have made homophobic slurs or statements in the past, and/or have homophobic lyrics in their songs. In certain cases it’s hard to be sure if the homophobia was deliberate, like in The Kink’s “Lola” which leaves things kinda mysterious. In other cases, like The Spice Girls’ “2 Become 1”, heteronormativity is espoused, like in their lyric “Any deal that we endeavour/boys and girls go good together”. Though, to their credit, in recent years, a new version of that song has emerged, which has changed the lyrics to: “Once again when we endeavour, love will bring us back together” which is more inclusive. This puts us in a bit of a quandry, as you can imagine, because it’s hard to keep track of every homophobic artist and every homophobic song, and even more difficult to parse out the meaning behind every lyric. Additionally, this brings into question whether we necessarily need to attach the views of an individual artist or band to a particular song. What if the artist is homophobic, but the band is not, and the song has nothing to do with queerness? Should we enjoy the song? Here, at Slowdance, after much agonizing, we’ve decided to take on the possibly controversial policy of “Fuck It – it’s a great song.” We are going to play whatever song we like because it’s a wonderful song and succeeds in bringing people closer together. We know that some of you might disagree with this, and we look forward to your angry emails, but we are also big believers in Ani DiFranco’s truism: “Every tool is a weapon if you hold it right.” And we believe that any song can be made beautiful if you’re holding the right person in your arms.

♥ A NOTE ABOUT SAFETY: Sometimes it happens that there is someone in the crowd who will make you feel unsafe or uncomfortable when dancing. This does not have to be an obvious thing, like leading with their groin, or grabbing your bum. It could just be a weird feeling. You are more than within your rights to stop the dance right there, and not have to explain. Overwhelmingly, our guests are courteous and polite and will comport themselves like gentlefolk, but every event that is open to the public may occasionally encounter someone who is, let's be honest, kinda creepy. While we encourage testing limits, when it infringes on someone's boundaries, that is when we draw the line. If something like this happens, do please let the organizer know. The organizer is the man in the stunning dress at the DJ Laptop. He is both your mom & dad tonight and a safe person to come to if something happens, and we will try to resolve the situation with everyone's safety in mind.

♥ A NOTE ABOUT HELPING: We would love it if you would share our event on your Facebook page! You likely know hundreds of people we have never met, and in our attempts to bring slowdancing to everyone on the planet, we would really appreciate it if you would share the event. Thank you!

♥ ANOTHER NOTE ABOUT SAFETY: The organizer reserves the right to ask anyone to leave for any reason which he does not have to divulge to anyone.

♥ A NOTE ABOUT THE NOTES: Holy shit! Did you really read down this far? That's awesome. We always read all the minutiae & marginalia too.

pourquoi pas un guinness !!

des photos seront prisent pour faire un super montage lors cette période créative et complètement farfelu hihihi !

101 Vagina in MONTREAL !

Dates:
Saturday 17 May – Sunday 25 May, 2014

Venue:
Le repaire des 100 talents
5867 Rue Saint-Hubert
Montreal

See tour details here:
http://101vagina.com/usa-canada

Twitter: @101vagina
--------------------------

101 Vagina is coming to the USA and Canada with a Book Launch and Exhibition Tour!

This tour will mark the official launch of the 101 Vagina book in the USA and Canada.

The exhibitions will comprise all 101 photos and stories from the 101 Vagina book. Three months, six cities! I’m officially excited!


At a some of the exhibitions I will try to organise a one day Festival of the Vagina, pulling together local artists, performers, educators, etc. under the umbrella of celebrating the vagina and removing the taboos.

Know someone who might light to participate? Pass it on :)


ABOUT 101 VAGINA:

101 Vagina is about breaking down the taboo around vaginas and body image shame generally. It confronts the lies we are told about what’s normal and celebrates our uniqueness and diversity. 101 Vagina is also about the sharing of story, of experience; the passing down of knowledge and wisdom.

This book contains 101 beautiful black and white photos of 101 women, along with a message, story or poem written by each woman to accompany their photo. The messages are candid and span the spectrum of emotions. They are raw and honest and form a small compendium of women’s experiences with their bodies and womanhood in general, with a focus on the vagina.

101 Vagina is light and profound, cheeky and deep.

CARSICK CARS  (Indie Rock  |  BEIJING, CHINA)
https://soundcloud.com/carsick-cars

+

UUBBUURRUU  (Psych Rock  |  Montréal, Qc.)
http://uubbuurruu.bandcamp.com/

+

WHITE+  (Minimal Electronic  |  BEIJING, CHINA)
http://maybemars.org/index.php/artists/whiteplus/



Billets / Tickets:
$10.00 à l’avance / in advance
au/ at:  http://indiemontreal.ca/fr/?p=6620


$12.00 à la porte / at the door (s’il en reste / if not sold out)



Les portes ouvrent à 20h30 et le spectacle commence à 21h30 / Doors open at 8:30 pm and the show starts at 9:30 pm


***************************************************


Carsick Cars is one of the most established indie rock bands in China. Their much anticipated third studio album “3”, produced by Sonic Boom of Spacemen 3 and Hamish Kilgour of The Clean, in New York, is set to be released in March 2014.

Formed in 2005, almost from the very beginning Carsick Cars has been at the center of the musical explosion in Beijing and has received a mixture of snarling opprobrium, especially from some of their elders, and near-fanatic enthusiasm from their rapidly growing fan base among culturally sophisticated but alienated young Chinese around the country.

Their 20-city tour of China in March 2009 with label-mates The Gar has already passed into Chinese musical history as one of the key events in the development of the Chinese independent music scene, and their shows indicate how for many in the young audience Carsick Cars “belongs” to themas much as the young Bob Dylan “belonged” to his fans in the mid 1960s.

Besides being one of the most admired and written-about bands in China, they have also received a huge amount of attention from musicians and critics in Europe and North America, having played in numerous festivals, most notably All Tomorrow’s Parties in the UK and the Primavera Sound in Barcelona, and toured with Sonic Youth in Europe.
Their second studio album was the long-awaited “You Can Listen, You Can Talk” a follow up of two years of explosive and almost joyful anger evoked in their first album, “Panda Noise”. Produced by P.K.14 frontman Yang Haisong, their first CD threw out into the Chinese indie scene some of its most iconic songs, including “Zhongnanhai”, widely seen as the anthem of
disenfranchised Chinese youth, and “Rock and Roll Hero”, a standard for younger bands.
“You Can Listen, You Can Talk” was produced by legendary producer Wharton Tiers after New York composer John Myers caught a Carsick Cars show during his visit to Shanghai and was so struck by the band that he immediately began lobbying for Tiers to produce them. As might be expected, the second CD is much bleaker and more complex than the first, with delicate, shimmering songs side by side with powerful, rage-filled eruptions of noise and chaos. 

But for all their differences both CDs are marked by the almost magical song-writing skill of front man Shouwang, whose facility for combining complex harmonic structures with beautiful melodies and straight ahead guitar riffs make him one of he best songwriters in the world.

https://soundcloud.com/carsick-cars

Indie Montréal présente/ presents...


SHANE JACOB PHILIPS  (Folk/Soul  |  The Voice  |   Portland, OR.)
www.shanephilips.com

+

invité spécial



Billets / Tickets:
$8.00 à l’avance / in advance
au/ at:  http://indiemontreal.ca/fr/?p=6849


$10.00 à la porte / at the door (s’il en reste / if not sold out)



Les portes ouvrent à 21h00 et le spectacle commence à 22h00 / Doors open at 9:00 pm and the show starts at 10:00 pm


***************************************************



Social Justice and Peace is Shane Philips’ latest release in two years and is a departure from his last three albums that were rooted deeply in traditional soul. Searching for something more, Philips decided to immerse himself into a community of folk artists and was able to focus his songwriting around stories that spoke to his life growing in a farm town and countless other events that would eventually shape his life as he traveled around the world. Philips eventually found himself at a piano in Nashville Tennessee where his roots in soul finally found convergence with the narrative he was searching for in folk music.

After the death of his father, Philips tumbled fast a furious into an abyss where he found himself heart broken from the breakup of a seven year relationship, bankrupt and in jail. The universe would eventually bale him out with a job that eventually proved more than a paycheck. It was the vocation of working with homeless youth not very much younger than him. Life experience would prove indispensable. Two years later Philips’ caught his wave to Africa where his travels would complete his father’s wish at the top of Kilimanjaro. Frostbite from that summit would not hold Philips back. He would return to North America with a sense of urgency. His music would have to be relevant to himself before anyone else. His Actions would have to speak louder than words. His “Walk For Water” would galvanize the spirit and at that moment Social Justice & Peace was born.

Social Justice and Peace does what it says. It speaks to ideas that used to unite the world but now divide us. Philips with a voice truly beyond his years tells a story that music of today rarely talks about. His message asks us to look inward and act outward with the idea that love is the universal fabric that holds humanity together.

Shane Philips has performed throughout Europe and North America with notable shows at the Montreal Jazz Festival, a guest singer with the Wooten Brothers in Nashville, TN and a participant on the NBC show "The Voice".


www.shanephilips.com

1399523136977599.description:
(English follows)
 
Pour célébrer leur longue carrière et marquer la fin de leur collaboration artistique, les Suédois Sebastian Mullaert et Marcus Henriksson, mieux connus sous le nom de MINILOGUE, participeront à deux événements spéciaux AVANT_MUTEK, le 18 avril à Montréal et le 19 avril à Toronto (ce dernier étant organisé en collaboration avec nos amis de Breakandenter) https://www.facebook.com/events/626579577413234/

Les deux artistes ont construit ensemble un univers sonore particulier et varié, leurs innombrables disques et collaborations puisant aussi bien dans la house que la techno ou le jazz, l'ambiant ou l'improvisation frénétique, alliant aussi des conceptualisations visuelles animées. Leur première apparition à MUTEK Montréal remonte à 2010, suivie d'une performance improvisée de 3 heures avec MATHEW JONSON lors de MUTEK 2012. À Toronto, ils performeront en revanche pour la toute première fois! 

Soulignons que ces deux dates s'inscrivent dans une mini-tournée nord-américaine qui représente une sorte de dénouement pour le duo, car MINILOGUE prendra par la suite une pause à durée indéterminée, les artistes souhaitant se concentrer sur leurs projets solos et sur de nouvelles opportunités. Comme ils l'expliquent eux-mêmes : « Nous pensons qu'il est temps d'explorer de nouveaux univers musicaux, chacun de notre côté. Nous nous soutenons mutuellement dans cette démarche et sommes enthousiastes en vue des aventures musicales qui nous attendent. » Cet apparent adieu se traduira par une performance live de plusieurs heures, une prouesse technologique et musicale qui enchantera les fans dans les deux villes. 

Sur Ticketpro, le prix est désormais de 30$ (tx in) + frais.
https://secure.ticketpro.ca/achat_ESP18DS14.html?aff=mutek&lang=fr

Les billets sont également en vente à Atom Heart - 364 Sherbrooke Est.

Plus à la porte
  
/////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

In North America this spring to celebrate - and to retire their almost 2 decade collaboration as MINILOGUE - MUTEK is proud to present the Swedish duo in Montréal on April 18 and Toronto on April 19 (in collaboration with our friends, Breakandenter). 
https://www.facebook.com/events/626579577413234/

Sebastian Mullaert and Marcus Henriksson have honed a peculiar and wide ranging sound over countless releases and collaborations - from house and techno to jazz, ambient, frenetic improvisation and even animated visual conceptualizations. They appeared for the first time at MUTEK in 2010 before teaming up for a 3 hour improv with MATHEW JONSON, during our 2012 edition. They have never played in Toronto. This tour marks a kind of denouement as they take an indefinite hiatus from this project to focus on solo pursuits and new opportunities. 

In a statement, the duo explained: "We feel that the time has come for us to explore new musical universes, one by one. We support each other fully in this and are excited about the musical adventures we have in front of us." MINILOGUE will fill these farewell appearances with their unbridled technological and musical prowess, performing multi-hour live sets in both cities.

Tickets (limited quantities):

On Ticketpro, tickets are now at 30$ (tx in) +sc.

Tickets are also available at Atom Heart - 364 Sherbrooke East.

More at the door

Reconnu comme le pays le plus violent au monde où règnent l’impunité et la corruption, le Honduras subit une violence endémique qui affecte l’ensemble de la population, particulièrement les défenseurs des droits humains. Malgré le coup d’État de 2009 et suite aux élections controversées de novembre dernier, le gouvernement canadien est déterminé à y conclure une entente de libre-échange.

Bertha Oliva du Comité des familles de détenus et disparus du Honduras (COFADEH) témoignera du contexte général d’insécurité et de la manipulation que le gouvernement actuel fait de cette précarité depuis les élections. Elle abordera aussi les impacts potentiels de l’accord de libre-échange canado-hondurien au niveau des droits humains.

Cette présentation sera introduite par un exposé de Claude Vaillancourt d’ATTAC-Québec portant sur le libre-échange avec le Honduras en lien avec la politique canadienne en ce domaine

Cet événement est organisé en concertation par Mer et Monde, le Comité pour les droits humains en Amérique latine (CDHAL), le Centre Justice et Foi, Alternatives et le Comité UQAM-Amérique Latine. 

Pour plus d’information : 
Contactez Julie Désilets de Mer et Monde, 514.495.8583 ou julie.desilets@mond.ca.

1406519146281350.name: Conférence de Bertha Oliva (COFADEH) à Montréal - Violations des droits humains au Honduras : quel rôle pour le Canada ?

1408630386059436.description:
Phase 1: 18h
Anyone who has had some experience with YBR®, wishes to go deeper into their own self-evaluation and possibly become a certified practitioner is welcome to enroll in Phase 1. 
Experiential anatomy lessons are the core of the YBR®curricula. This provides students with the foundation needed to develop confident therapeutic skills. 
We start you at the beginning feeling your own muscles from origin to insertion. Knowing how to find and feel your own muscles are crucial to problem solving and helping others to heal themselves. 
Teaching skills are gradually integrated with ongoing study and practice of YBR® routines so that students get YBR® into their own bodies and they empower their own students and clients to become fixers of their own bodies.

Class outline:
YBR® History
Basic guidelines and theories of YBR®
Experiential Anatomy
- Hamstrings
- Posterior Calf
- Spine
- Quadriceps
- Adductors
- Anterior Calf
- Abdominal Muscles
- Chest and Neck

The instructor first demonstrates, then supervises and offers corrections. Students can follow along with the Manual. Questions are encouraged and answered at all times during the course. 

Course Objectives: Upon completion of Phase 1 students will have:
-an understanding of the theories of YBR® 
-experientially learned how to find and work all muscles covered in this phase 
-experienced the nature of muscle release and the order and logic by which it happens 
-have learned all YBR routines for the anterior and posterior body 

You can obtain a registration form by clicking on Registration on our website, or by sending a mail to Education Coordinator Isabel Eisen: education@yamunabodyrolling.com, or phone Isabel: (212) 367-9570.

Price: $620.00 (Early registration discount of $75 until February 21st.)

Registration forms: http://www.yamunabodyrolling.com/training/registration/index.php

1411202009112190.description:
Comme plusieurs le savent déjà, mon frère a été diagnostiqué avec un cancer de la thyroïde de stade 4 en juillet 2013. Pour lui et pour ceux et celles qui se battent contre cette maladie, je vais courir un demi-marathon au profit de la recherche sur le cancer de la thyroïde (  Faculté de Médecine de l'université de Sherbrooke, département d'endocrinologie) et pour la Fondation En Coeur. 

Je vous invite à vous joindre à moi pour les prochains mois. Mon frère va continuer son combat et à ma façon je vais combattre avec lui en me donnant la meilleure santé possible. Au plaisir de vous lire, de nous encourager mutuellement vers une meilleure santé et qui sait: être ensemble sur la ligne de départ en septembre 2014! :)

Et pourquoi la fondation En Coeur? Parce que j'ai une cardiopathie congénitale et que grâce à la fondation, mon frère et mes parents ont pu être présent à mes côtés lors de ma chirurgie à coeur ouvert. Comme on dit: donnez au suivant!
1411202009112190.name: Demi-Marathon de Montréal pour la recherche sur le cancer de la Thyroïde et  En Coeur

1411401339108980.description:
Transition Prod & Team 140 Montreal PRÉSENTENT:

MONTRÉAL VS. QUÉBEC

*Les places sont limitées, réservez la vôtre dès maintenant! * : http://wantickets.com/team140

============================================

Vous êtes l'un de ceux ou de celles qui se sont déjà posés la question suivante « l'arbitre??? », ou encore: «qu'est-ce qui revient le moins cher pour la population: le Pont Champlain ou l'amphithéâtre de Québec? ». Rassurez-vous, vos questions seront toutes répondues le 22 mars par communiqué officiel (ou pas, dépendamment du degré de corruption à cette date).
Mais avant toute chose, un match décisif entre des DJs choisis personnellement par les élites de Montréal et Québec.

Puisque la mode c'est d'être DJ de nos jours, nos élites ont décidé que la rivalité devait être répondue, non pas par le hockey, mais par les DJs. Seuls eux peuvent décider de l'avenir culturelle, économique et politique du Québec. Le pouvoir réside entre leurs mains.

Ainsi, le 22 mars, retrouvez vos DJs dans un rave underground au bunker Transition. Trance, Goa, Psy-Trance, Techno... seront les styles musicaux mis en rivalité de 21h à 7h30am. Qui sera l'heureux vainqueur? Quelle ville a la meilleure poutine? C'est à vous de décider.

« C'est où le Transition Bunker? Connais pas.»

Hé bien, malgré que ce lieu fut gardé secret jusqu'à tout récemment, le bunker Transition est le nom de code donné au futur amphithéâtre de Québec. Nous jugeons bon de reprendre le match de 1984 là où il serait, sur fond de Psy-Trance.

Vous savez le meilleur dans tout ça? APPORTEZ VOTRE ALCOOL

1414550962136447.description:
* Ceci est l'événement pour la représentation À MONTRÉAL*

Le 3 avril, 19h30,  au Cinéma Beaubien,
C'est la 2ème édition de Juste Pour Dire.
Une soirée de lecture hyper colorée, où nous nous prêtons au jeu de l'écriture, interprétant à tour de rôle un monologue que l'un de nos camarades nous a écrit. De plus cette année, nous avons des auteurs invités, des vrais: Marie-Hélène Larose-Truchon et Benjamin Pradet (tous deux promus de l'École Nationale de théâtre, en écriture dramatique).
--
Aussi, c'est une soirée bénéfice pour sortir et partir en tournée avec "Reviens!", un spectacle jeune public écrit par Marie-Hélène Larose-Truchon, et mis-en-scène par Marie-Ève Huot, spectacle qu'il nous a été donné de présenter à l'hiver dernier. 

15$ adulte
10$ étudiants et anciens de l'Option-Théâtre.
Cash seulement sur place.
Les billets seront aussi en vente auprès des membres de notre cohorte.

Places limitées. Réservez votre place en écrivant à l'adresse suivante (en indiquant votre nom et  le nombre de places désirées): 

groupereviens.financement@hotmail.fr

*Sur place, seront vendus les Recueils de textes de la soirée, et autres, argent comptant seulement.

--
Des milliers d’histoires sur la langue 
À la veille du départ. 
Des milliers d’histoires sur la langue 
À la ligne d’arrivée. 
Le vent dans les voiles,
 Les tours dans les poches, 
Le front tout le tour de la tête. 
Nous entamons de grandes foulées, 
Battantes. 
Et de notre souffle, 
De nos bouches aux oreilles,
Il y a le vœux de transmettre dans la ronde,
Aux petites et grandes âmes
À ceux qui ne veulent rien entendre
À ceux trop jeunes pour comprendre
À tous ceux tous ceux tous ceux, avides à vie.
Avides de mots et de rencontres. 
Avides d’aventures, d’anecdotes, de murmures, de secrets, de baumes, de berceuses, de chansons, de road-trips, et de rumeurs voyageuses, à travers le temps… 
À tous ceux-là.
Que ça se raconte…
--

Le documentariste italien Agostino Ferrente  (sélectionné aux festivals de Locarno, de Venise, etc.)
 à Montréal 4 - 5 - 6 et 8  projections et conférences, grâce à un partenariat entre La Chaire René-Malo de l'Ecole des médias/UQAM, La Cinémathèque Québécoise, l'École de cinéma Mel Hoppenheim de la Concordia, l'Institut Italien Culturel de Montréal.

Ferrente est né en 1971 dans les Pouilles en Italie du Sud, il réside à Rome et il a été élève d'Ermanno Olmi (palme d'or au Festival de Cannes en 1978). Il a contribué à la renaissance du nouveau documentaire italien et à la redécouverte du cinéma de Vittorio De Seta (primé dans les années 50 et 60 à Cannes et Venise) dont il a été très proche.
Le programme détaillé est ici : http://www.iicmontreal.esteri.it/IIC_Montreal/webform/SchedaEvento.aspx?id=449&citta=Montreal

1418771005041145.description:
Les éditions Dialogue Nord-Sud sont heureuses d’annoncer la parution en Amérique du Nord du dernier livre de Ferhat Mehenni, La France va-t-elle perdre l’Afrique ?, un essai essentiel à la compréhension des  rapports de la France avec l’Afrique francophone.

Le lancement aura lieu le samedi 12 avril, à 14h00, à la Société Saint-Jean-Baptiste de Montréal, sise au 82 rue Sherbrooke Ouest. 

L’auteur interviendra de Paris via Skype et répondra aux questions du public.   

Extrait :
«  L’Afrique francophone est-elle la propriété de la France ? Les États qui y sont érigés sont tous de fabrication française. Mais, depuis ce que l’on appelle la décolonisation, on est en droit de penser que la tutelle française est levée. Décolonisation ne signifie pas forcément indépendance… L’Afrique est confiée à des gérants d’États choisis parmi les autochtones, mais elle demeure le domaine réservé de la France qui y agit comme si elle était toujours chez elle… Les interventions militaires françaises en Côte-d’Ivoire, en 2011, au Mali, en 2013, et aujourd’hui en Centrafrique, quelles qu’en soient leurs justifications, sont là pour le confirmer.
Le temps de reconsidérer la politique française en Afrique est donc venu. Il y a lieu d’en faire le bilan et d’en tirer toutes les conséquences. C’est le moment de mettre sur pied de nouvelles alternatives devant conduire l’Afrique vers la liberté, notamment par l’exercice du droit à l’autodétermination des peuples qui y aspirent. »

Éditions Dialogue Nord-Sud
dialoguenordsud@gmail.com 
www.dialoguenordsud.com
1418771005041145.name: Lancement du dernier livre de Ferhat Mehenni à Montréal

1420337624885731.description:
Laurent Thomas

Laissez Laurent Thomas vous emmener dans son univers aux teintes folk, blues et rock. La dualité entre le rythme et le calme, l’attachement et la solitude vous fera voyager dans son monde musical. Accompagné de membres de sa famille dans son projet musical, Laurent Thomas offre un spectacle qui vous fera sentir une proximité avec l’artiste tout en vous faisant taper du pied.

www.laurentthomas.com 
http://laurentthomasltm.bandcamp.com/

Fred Labrie

À force de rêver tout le temps à grand ou à moins grand, 
Labrie a décidé de prendre sa guitare, un crayon et de mettre sur scène tout se qui se passe dans sa tête, tous ces échappatoires si simples que permet la chanson avec ses images et ses mélodies. Pour lui, le folk passe par l’authenticité, le retour au vrai, à la simplicité d’une bulle autour d’un atome de vie, d’une rencontre intime entre le public et soi. Le calme de Ste-Julie et l’hyperactivité de Montréal ont provoqué ce monde parallèle, lunaire, festif, authentique et chaleureux qui nous happe à la réalité et inspire autant le tapage de pied que la tournée de câlins. Accompagné de ses musiciens (banjo/mandoline et contrebasse), il a près de dix ans de parcours et de spectacles partout au Québec (il a par ailleurs remporté divers prix prestigieux, dont un prix de la SOCAN). Cette expérience et son amour de la scène et du public transparaissent dans chaque accord, dans chaque parole de la poésie musicale de Labrie pour faire vivre aux spectateurs un moment des plus enivrants. Après avoir lancé un premier EP en juin 2012, Les Bruits sourds, il travaille maintenant à un premier album prévu pour la fin de l'année 2014.

www.labrie.info
1420337624885731.name: Laurent Thomas et Fred Labrie à L'escalier Montréal

1430391853866162.description:
LE NOUVEAU INTERNATIONAL PRESENTS:

The 9th annual
Montreal Sketch Comedy Festival
May 19th - 25th, 2014

In 2014, Montreal’s Sketchfest promises to be bigger and better than ever! More troupes! More awards! More cash prizes! More parties! For 6 nights in May, Théâtre Ste. Catherine will be filled with the laughter and the laughter-tears that only top-notch sketch comedy can produce. Troupes from absolutely everywhere, performing in French, English or both, are encouraged to apply before the April 1st deadline. On April 15th we will announce what will no doubt be a killer line-up.

With over 10 shows to choose from, a festival pass is the best way to take in all Montreal Sketchfest has to offer. Don’t want to wait until April 15th to see who is performing? For those who just want to feed their sketch comedy hunger, passes are on sale right now at the low low price of $45. They are available at www.theatrestecatherine.com

This year, we have added some benefits for participating troupes including a sweet discount for performers with our accommodation partner, the Hostelling International - Montréal hostel and new prizes for the best troupes including Yelp’s Audience Choice Award, The Zoofest Award featuring a spot in the Zoofest line-up, and Bloody Underrated’s Best Local Troupe Award. Representatives from the programming department at Just for Laughs will be there, scouting for some of the best sketch comedy talent there is and offering a cash prize to their favorite troupe. As always we will be offering the classic favorites including Le Nouveau International’s Bag of Beer Award for the best newcomer and the coveted Giant Piece of Bark Award for our favorite troupe. Troupes wishing to participate can download the application form at http://montrealsketchfest.com/

And you know there will be parties. Unforgettable parties that you will tell your grandchildren about. So what are you waiting for? Send us your application or buy your pass maintenant. We’ll see you at the fest!


-----------------------------------------------

Le Nouveau International présente: 

La 9e édition du
Sketchfest de Montréal
19-25 mai 2014

En 2014, le Sketchfest de Montréal promet d’être mieux que jamais! Plus de troupes! Plus de prix! Plus de récompenses en argent! Plus de fête! Pendant six soirées de mai, le Théâtre Ste-Catherine sera rempli de rires et de rires aux larmes, comme seuls les meilleurs sketchs peuvent en produirent. Les troupes de partout au monde, performant en français, en anglais, ou les deux, sont invitées à poser leur candidature avant la date limite du 1er avril. Le 15 avril, nous annoncerons ce qui sera sans aucun doute une programmation à tout casser.

Avec un choix de plus de dix spectacles, la passe du festival est la meilleure façon de profiter de tout ce que le Sketchfest de Montréal a à offrir. Vous ne pouvez pas attendre jusqu’au 15 avril pour finalement savoir qui sera de la partie? Procurez-vous une passe lève-tôt dès maintenant! En vente jusqu’au 1er mars au bas prix de 30$ au www.theatrestecatherine.com

Cette année, nous avons décrocher plusieurs promotions alléchantes pour les troupes participantes, incluant un incroyable rabais pour les artistes chez notre partenaire en logement, l’auberge de jeunesse Hostelling International - Montréal, en plus de nouveaux prix pour les meilleures troupes, incluant le Prix Choix du Public Yelp, le Prix Zoofest - qui promet une place dans la programmation du prochain Zoofest, et le Prix Bloody Underrated pour la Meilleure Troupe Locale. Des représentants de Juste pour Rire seront là, à la recherche des meilleurs talents, en plus d’offrir un prix en argent liquide à leur troupe préférée. Comme toujours, nous offrirons les classiques Prix Bag of Beer du Nouveau International pour la Meilleure Troupe Émergente, et le tant convoité Prix Giant Piece of Bark pour notre Troupe Préférée! Les troupes désirant participer peuvent télécharger le formulaire d’application à montrealsketchfest.com

Et vous savez qu’il y a aura des partys. Des partys mémorables que vous raconterez plus tard à vos petits-enfants. Alors qu’est-ce que vous attendez? Envoyez votre application ou achetez votre passe maintenant. On se voit au festival!

1431314167081452.description:
Excision 2014 tour dates announced and the return of The Executioner.

Get tickets for Montreal @ http://smarturl.it/XMar29Tickets

There is truly no sleep for the wicked, as Canadian Dubstep pioneer Excision announces his massive 2014 Tour. Starting this January Excision will hit the road only weeks after wrapping the final string of Destroid live shows for 2013. 

Embracing an unyielding pursuit to push the boundaries of bass music, Excision is continually creating and re-imagining innovative uses of cutting edge technology to impact his fans, as well as the EDM community at large. This 2014 Tour will prove to be his most extensive and most immersive tour experience to date. With an already phenomenal level of production at his disposal, you better believe he has gone even further. He is stepping things up to a whole new level and bringing a monstrous 150,000 watts of sound, which is capable of delivering insanely loud yet crystal clear audio to blast dance floors with room shaking bass in a way that bass music is ultimately designed to be felt as well as heard.

The 2014 tour also marks the return of the 28 foot wide, 15 foot tall mammoth video and lighting installation known as The Executioner. This custom crafted stage production was specifically designed for Excisions 3D video mapped visual sequences as he DJ's both music and video live on stage. The Executioner is fully recharged and returning as Excision’s on-stage bass bunker, complete with brand new 3D visual animations displayed across its 420 square feet of surface area. This technological audio video monstrosity is equipped with various sliding panels and pneumatics to hide lazers, fog machines, an extensively upgraded lighting system and more than a few surprises yet to be revealed.


Dirtyphonics
-
Dirtyphonics, the fabulous french DJ team joins with Excision for his 2014 tour. Bringing their signature style of genre bending madness from DNB, Electro House and everything in between, don't miss a second of their electrifying sets as they set the world on fire!
1431314167081452.name: Excision in Montreal @ Le Métropolis de Montréal

1435357566680218.description:
Les Marinellis


LE KID ET LES MARINELLIS aus Montreal sind wieder auf Europatour!! Zum Glück!!!
Hammer live band!! 

Review ihrer ersten LP auf P-Trash Rec.

What sounds like a wild Spaghetti Western Show or a familiy of sensational trapeze artists is a wonderful legere quintet from the city of Montreal with their first complete delivery.
They captured their juvenile je ne care attitude in 11 cool and übermelodic songs that dangle between a variety of styles. The whole thingy starts off with some pretty snotful '77 Punk and ends in an acoustic Country song. In between you get some more mid-tempo 60ies Rock'nRollers, kind of BLACK LIPS meet the MOJOMATICS, some Blues caputte aka CHOCOLAT, some Psychedelia... the DEMON'S CLAWS manner, and some more wild hypnotize garage-punk songs like JACK O' FIRE, REAL KIDS or DIRTBOMBS. The french lyrics are sung like the young MICK JAGGER!
Always smooth. Always laid back. Always snotty as hell. Always hit. Long live les beautiful girls. Long live LE KID.

1443525909217883.description:
E27 est fier de s’associer à l’Ensemble Paramirabo pour présenter ce concert soulignant le talent des compositeurs de Québec et de Montréal. D’après le site internet Bachtrack, l’ensemble est décrit comme étant « une perle rare » et démontrant un « courage sans limites – né exclusivement de l’inspiration créatrice, leur avenir prometteur est à ne pas manquer ».

Placé sous le thème des échanges musicaux entre les villes de Québec et de Montréal, la programmation du concert mettra en valeur la vitalité de la création dans ces deux villes et soulignera les différences et similitudes esthétiques entre les musiques de Québec et de Montréal. Parmi les compositeurs au programme, Geneviève Dupuis, Patrick Giguère et Patrick Saint-Denis ont tous les trois complété leur formation à Québec alors que François Morel et Denis Gougeon ont réalisé une partie importante de leur carrière à Québec. Lori Freedman et Maxime McKinley représentent la ville de Montréal. 

Ce concert sera également l’occasion de célébrer la musique de Denis Gougeon, compositeur mis à l’honneur par la SMCQ en 2013-2014 dans le cadre de sa série Hommage.

Vous pouvez vous procurer des billets à la billetterie du Palais Montcalm et sur Billetech:
30 ans et moins - 22$
Admission générale - 28$

Ce concert est une initiative de Maxime McKinley, compositeur en résidence de la Chapelle-Historique du Bon Pasteur de Montréal et y sera aussi présenté le 28 mars.
1443525909217883.name: Québec-Montréal

Les portes ouvrent à 20h30 et le spectacle commence à 21h30 / Doors open at 8:30 pm and the show starts at 9:30 pm


***************************************************



Le Canadien d’Ottawa, Laurent Bourque a commencé à jouer de la guitare dès l'âge de 9 ans et n'a jamais arrêté. 

En 2010, Laurent lance son premier album intégral, What We Talk About, pour lequel il reçoit maints éloges. Depuis le lancement du disque, Laurent donne des spectacles un peu partout en Amérique du Nord et participe à bon nombre de festivals comme le RBC Ottawa Bluesfest, le North By Northeast, le POP Montréal et la Semaine de la musique canadienne. Il partage la scène avec des artistes de renommée tels Buck 65, Andrew Bird, The Great Lake Swimmers et Dan Mangan. What We Talk About est souvent joué sur les ondes de Radio-Canada et de divers programmes télévisés de MTV et de E! Network.

Cette année, Laurent Bourque lance son deuxième album Pieces of Your Past qu'il a enregistré avec le producteur connu Dave Draves (Kathleen Edwards, Julie Doiron, Jim Bryson). L'album présente une musique folk/pop charmante, mélodieuse et franche qui touche tous les thèmes de la vie lorsqu'on est en amour.  

Cette fois, Laurent a fait l'enregistrement « live » en studio accompagné de son groupe de musiciens talentueux dont Jamie Kronick (batterie) et Philippe Charbonneau (basse). Pieces of Your Past est sans aucun doute le résultat du mariage harmonieux de la voix à la fois mélodieuse et puissante de Laurent et du partage d’émotion, de sonorité et de personnalité. 
____________

This year, Ottawa singer-songwriter Laurent Bourque presents his sophomore record: Pieces of Your Past. 

Recorded with renowned producer Dave Draves, (Kathleen Edwards, Julie Doiron, Jim Bryson) the result is a charming, beautiful and honest folk/pop record addressing all themes of life in love.

Laurent recorded Pieces of Your Past ‘live to tape’ in the studio alongside his talented backing band (Jamie Kronick, Drums, Phil Charbonneau, Bass,) completing the majority of the album in a single day. A rare thing in today’s music scene, the live recording setting allowed for more feeling, and character to shine through Laurent’s accomplished songwriting.

Anchored by Laurent’s melodic and powerful vocal style, the feelings, sounds and personality of Pieces of Your Past are what make it an undeniably exciting record.


www.laurentbourque.com

Annie Sama est une auteure-compositrice-interprète Canadienne de Montréal,  Québec, qui performe sous le nom APigeon. Mélodies sensibles sublimées d’harmonies vocales qui rassemblent les influences en ralliant paysages rythmiques et poésie.

Issu d’une experience éclectique et d’influences diverses, APigeon évolue dans un univers immersif, où la création visuelle fait partie intégrante de l’aventure stylistique.

Le projet a déjà reçu l’attention de quelques publications et émissions de radio. Selon IX Daily APigeon a été l’une des grandes découvertes musicales du festival Pop Montreal 2013.

Son premier album APigeon is Born sortira au début de l’année 2014.
___________

Annie Sama is a Canadian electronic producer, signer-songwriter from Montreal, Quebec, performing under the name of APigeon. Heartfelt melodies and boundless harmonies sowed together in rhythmic soundscapes and poetry.

Hailing from an eclectic background and wide-ranging influences, APigeon evolves in an immersive universe, building into a stylistic venture where visuals are also a centerpiece.

The project has already received the attention of several publications and radio stations. IX Daily titled APigeon among the great musical discoveries of Pop Montréal 2013 Festival.

Her debut album APigeon is Born is due at the begining of 2014.

1458495154379946.description:
Pavillon Jean-Brillant, 3200 Rue Jean Brillant, Amphithéâtre B-0245

GRATUIT ET OUVERT À TOUS // FREE AND OPEN TO EVERYONE

17H15 // LE SAVOIR DU VÉCU

MON ONCLE ANTOINE
Déia Gunn, Gracy Brazeau | Canada | 5 min | 2013 | vo Anishnabe, Français | st Français
L’oncle Antoine ne parle qu’Anishnabe. Sa nièce Délia ne peut le comprendre. Elle sait toutefois qu’il lui reste peu de temps à vivre et imagine ce qu’il dirait aux siens avant de les quitter.

KUNGYEE
Chaoba Thiyam, Tangkhul Naga | Inde | 2013 | 29 min | vo Hindi | st Anglais
Kungyee présente un rituel de la pluie du village de Ningthi dans le nord-est de l’Inde, près du Myanmar. Plusieurs étapes de ce rite son décrites, en passant par la forêt, les chants, les costumes, pour finir dans le lit d’une rivière. Plusieurs restrictions concernant ceux pouvant participer à cet événement sont révélés. Cette pratique autochtone nous démontre la liaison des membres d’une communauté au sein de ce rituel et la forme actuelle du Kungyee tel qu’il est encore pratiqué.

ORIGINS
Jeffrey Palmer | 18 min  | vo Kiowa | st Anglais
Through digital film-making, “Origins” represents a grandfather and grandson’s perspectives of Kiowa (native American) history and storytelling, which together from a visual document tracing the director’s ancestral beginnings. These generational voices lead the audience through the landscape of Kiowa Country, surveiying the origins and ceremonial sites of Kiowa identity.

18H45 // HUMAIN DE NATURE

WIGWAS
Karl Cherrier | Canada | 6 min  | vo Anglais | st Anglais
Karl raconte sa philosophie de la vie à travers la fabrication de son canot à base d’écorce de bouleau traditionnel.

LESPOUÈRE
Moïse Marcoux-Chabot | Canada | 20 min | 2013 | vo Français
Portrait du militant écologiste Bilbo Cyr, poète et slameur gaspésien, qui parle de sa région comme il l’habite: avec passion et poésie,  mais aussi avec colère. Il défend et fait vivre son territoire par la parole, son arme de prédilection, semant du rêve dans la terre et les esprits.

LE CHANT DE LA FLEUR
Jacques Dochamps | 60 min | vo Espagnol, Quechua | st Français
Menacé par l’industrie pétrolière, le peuple amazonien de Sarayaku mène une lutte sans répit pour sa survie. Inspiré par un chant chamanique ancestral, il s’engage dans un défi inouï à portée universelle; la Frontière de Vie.

LIFE IS
Vladimir Perovic | 25 min
Regions of the karsts offer little to man. And it’s hard to pick up the little something from harsh environment. Any present from such a nature is precious, and it means a life. And people have to go uphill and uphill...Strong condensed images, with no words spoken, and no music used, offer six examples of the co-existence between man and karsts…

22H // Discussion à continuer au bar Grande Gueule, 5615 A Ch De La Cote Des Neiges, Montréal

Montréal Etsy Team est fière de vous présenter son premier salon fait main rassemblant 20 artisans locaux.

Le printemps est à nos portes et juste a temps pour la fête des mères. Venez nous reconter en cette belle journée d'avril pour découvrir bijoux, tricot, vêtements, accessoires, photographie, parfums organiques, produits pour le bain, art visuel, laine feutrée et beaucoup plus!

Qu' est-ce qu'est le Montréal Etsy Team et Etsy?

Montréal Etsy Team est un groupe d'individus créatifs situé à Montréal et en périphérique qui ont choisi Etsy comme platforme de vente. Notre équipe priorise le commerce local et le support de nos artisants locaux.  www.etsy.com/teams/6762/montreal-etsy-team

Etsy et un site de vente et d'achat pour des produits fait main, objects vintage et produits de fabrication.
La communauté et composée d'entreprises créatives et indépendantes de partout dans le monde.
Clickez ici pour plus d'informations: www.etsy.com/about

www.StudioSundari.com

The Montreal Etsy team is proud to present it's first handmade fair featuring 20 great local artisans. 

With spring around the corner and just in time before Mother's day. Come out on this warm April day and enjoy everything from jewelry, knitted & sewn products, photography, organic perfumes, bathtime goodies, fine art, hand felting and much much more!

Who is the the Montreal Etsy Team and what is Etsy?

The Montreal Etsy Team are a group of creative individuals found in Montreal and around the area who choose Etsy as a selling platform. We as a team above all are here to promote buying local and supporting our local artisans. www.etsy.com/teams/6762/montreal-etsy-team

Etsy is an online marketplace for handmade goods, vintage items, and supplies for making. The community is made up of independent creative businesses from around the globe. Read more here: www.etsy.com/about 

We will be occupying Studio Sundari's event space located at 6262 Rue St. Hubert (right in plaza St.Hubert!) Sunday April 27th from 10am - 4pm. 
www.StudioSundari.com 

So bring friends and family and don't forget to share this event!

PLEASE NOTE: All tables for this event have already been filled.
To be added to our mailing list for future fairs please follow this link:

1512302732329876.description:
★★★ MONTREAL STRIP SPELLING BEE - Dark Knight Edition! ★★★

WARNING: There may be nudity in this show.

The game is played a lot like strip poker, but it's a spelling bee, and it's played in front of a live audience of hooters, hollerers and hecklers who want to see some smart and sexy skin!

As this is our Dark Knight edition, any contestant wearing a related costume, whether half-assed or high-end, will be looked upon more favourably by the judges.

......

Thursday, April 3, 2014
Mainline Theatre
3997 Blvd. St-Laurent
(Just south of Duluth - look for the sign with flames painted on it!)

Sign-up at 8:30 PM sharp!
Bee from 9 to midnight
$10 at the door
(Contestants do not pay cover and get a free drink!)

Please note that we must cap our number of strip-spellers at 10 to ensure an expedient and entertaining evening.

Regretfully, The Mainline  is not wheelchair-accessible, as it is up a steep flight of stairs.
18+

To be alerted to future Strip Spelling Bees in your area, please sign-up to the mailing list right here: http://eepurl.com/QHnpb   We promise not to email too much! Probably just once a month. We hate spam too!

**********************************************

OFFICIAL RULES:

One by one, participants are asked to spell a word. If they get it right, they sit down. If they get it wrong, they must striptease A THIRD of their clothing off, and that is considered their first "strike". When they misspell a second word, that is their second strike and they must striptease ANOTHER third off. A third and final strike requires that they strip down to their underwear.

After three strikes, a participant is out of the competition. But they should take heart – because while they may have lost, the audience has most certainly won.

Both the winner of the Bee and the Best Striptease of the night win (a) A CD with over an hour of cats purring! (b) A Choose-Your-Own-Adventure style book from the POV of a housecat during the zombie apocalpyse!

While the Best Speller of the night will be chosen through purely quantitative means, Best Stripper is chosen in a more qualitative manner by our Secret Judge whom we have embedded in the audience. As with all things, if you compete in COSTUME, the Secret Judge will look more favourably in your direction.

All striptease spellers do not pay cover.
Anyone can drop out of the competition at any time AFTER the completion of the SECOND round.

This is a queer, senior and trans-friendly event. We have a NO BOOING policy strictly in effect. No photos are allowed except by our host, who will talk to each of the contestants and ask if this is okay when they sign-up. Our goal is to have everyone feel safe, secure and comfortable enough to strip and spell.

Regarding the No Photos Rule - we also have a SNITCH POLICY. If you are a member of the audience and you witness someone taking a surreptitious photo, BY ALL MEANS, interrupt the proceedings, come up to one of the hosts - SNITCH on the guilty party, and once they have been dealt with, you will be rewarded with a free drink.

We thank you for your patronage and understanding.

HOW TO HELP US!
Sometimes, after an event, we get kind folks coming up to us asking us how they can help out with future quirky events. We are so grateful for your kindness and enthusiasm! But perhaps the Most Helpful Thing You Can Do is a thing that doesn't feel like very much help, but which is IN FACT the Most Helpful Thing You Can Do - and that's to share the event page on your Facebook Wall and let your friends know about it. That's it. It takes a few seconds, but is incredibly helpful. Seriously. Collectively, you all know thousands & thousands of people we have never met. If you could spread the word about quirky events, that helps us out manifestly and improves greatly the chances of quirky events continuing to happen! Will you be one of our Sharers?


****************************************************

Recently, we were fortunate enough to get some MEDIA COVERAGE:

http://www.thestar.com/article/831682--strip-spelling-bees-a-twist-on-age-old-tradition

http://www.theglobeandmail.com/life/style/strip-spelling-bees-are-the-latest-hipster-twist-on-burlesque/article1569064/

http://www.torontosun.com/news/torontoandgta/2010/05/07/13870906.html

(New York, NY – January XX, 2014)  Columbia Records recording artist T. Mills will hit the road this next month in support of his new single kicking off his All I Wanna Do headline tour on February 19 in Santa Barbara, CA, see below for full list of dates with additional tour dates to be announced. In preparation for the tour, T. Mills is readying the release of his new single “All I Wanna Do,” which will be released this spring.  

Exclusive VIP packages will be available beginning Friday January 17 at tmillsmusic.com, a full 24-hours before the general on-sale on Saturday January 18. The package includes one ticket to the show, a meet and greet and VIP merchandise bundle, visit tmillsmusic.com for full package details. Supporting Travis on the tour is BlackBear and Mod Sun on select dates. Hollywood, CA’s Blackbear is support for the first half of the tour as he gears up to release his new album “The Afterglow” due out 4/20/2014. Mod Sun joins on the remainder of the dates and will spread his music dripping in positivity as he preps the release of his debut album “Hippy Hop” in May 2014. 
 
Riverside, CA native Travis Mills has been able to turn a laptop musical experimentation in his bedroom into national tours and a deal with Columbia Records, all in just over two years. In March 2012, Mills received a 2012 MTV Woodie Award nomination for Best New Artist. Over the past few years he has amassed a dedicated and loyal fan base with over 45+ million cumulative Youtube views, 1 Million Facebook fans and 260,000 twitter followers. 

T. Mills is currently in the studio hard at work on his debut album with famed producers such as Boi1Da, Malay and Cook Classics to be released later this year.

193950554117361.description:
Après 10 ans d'absence, le baseball majeur est de retour à Montréal !

METS vs BLUE JAYS
Série de 2 matchs préparatoires / Stade Olympique
Vendredi 28 mars 2014 à 19h05 
Samedi 29 mars 2014 à 13h05
  
Billets en vente aux guichets du Stade Olympique
Par téléphone: 1 855 790-1245
Commandez en ligne: www.evenko.ca
Billet :  18$/ 28$/  43$/ 58$/ 83$ (taxes et frais de service inclus)
* Forfaits spéciaux et tarif pour enfants aussi disponibles

evenko est fier de présenter une série de deux matchs entre les Blue Jays de Toronto et les Mets de New York  au Stade olympique, les 28 et 29 mars 2014.

La formation torontoise, sous la direction du directeur général montréalais, et ancien membre des Expos de Montréal, Alex Anthopoulos, recevra ses homologues new-yorkais en préparation à la 145e saison du baseball majeur. La série qui mettra aux prises les représentants de la Ligue américaine, les Blue Jays, et les porte-couleurs de la Ligue nationale, les Mets, permettra aux amateurs de baseball de la grande région métropolitaine de renouer avec le baseball majeur et de voir à l’œuvre plusieurs des meilleurs joueurs du baseball majeur avec les puissants frappeurs Edwin Encarnacion, José Bautista et José Reyes ainsi que le lanceur R.A. Dickey et l’excellent joueur d’avant-champ canadien Brett Lawrie.
 
« Nous sommes enthousiastes à l’idée de voir les Blue Jays se produire à Montréal et donner aux amateurs de baseball de Montréal la chance de voir à nouveau du baseball majeur. Connaissant l’amour et la passion du baseball des amateurs au Québec, cette expérience sera sans contredit émotive pour plusieurs. Nous espérons que ces matchs sauront les intéresser aux Blue Jays et à raviver leur intérêt pour le baseball majeur », a indiqué Paul Beeston, président et chef de la direction, Blue Jays de Toronto.
 
Les deux formations n’en seront pas à une première série de matchs. Entre 1997 et 2012, depuis la tenue des matchs inter-ligues, elles se sont affrontées à 21 reprises, soit 12 fois à Toronto et neuf fois au domicile des Mets. Ces derniers, que les amateurs de baseball connaissent bien, l’ont emporté 15 fois, essuyant six revers. En sol canadien, les deux équipes ont une fiche de six victoires et autant d’échecs. Le dernier match entre les Jays et les Mets remonte au 20 mai 2012, alors que les Mets avaient signé un gain de 6 à 5, au Rogers Centre.
 
« Étant moi-même originaire de Montréal, je suis convaincu que cette série de deux matchs sera un événement mémorable. J’ai débuté ma carrière dans l’organisation des Expos et assisté à de nombreux matchs au Stade olympique. Ce sera électrisant de voir à nouveau le stade vibrer au rythme du baseball majeur », de dire Alex Anthopoulos, vice-président principal et directeur général, Blue Jays de Toronto.
 
Dans le cadre du retour du baseball majeur à Montréal, Baseball-Québec sera directement impliqué puisque des spécialistes seront sur place afin d’offrir des cliniques de baseball sur le terrain, le dimanche 30 mars. Afin de promouvoir le développement du sport chez les jeunes partout en province, Baseball-Québec participe à de nombreuses initiatives et programmes qui seront mis de l’avant dans le cadre de ces deux matchs au Stade olympique.
 
« Après plus d’une décennie sans baseball majeur à Montréal, nous sommes fiers d’avoir l’occasion de présenter ces deux matchs préparatoires entre deux équipes de premier plan et, du même coup, offrir aux partisans de baseball du Québec, du baseball de qualité tout en contribuant à l’essor et au développement du baseball grâce à l’implication de Baseball Québec », a ajouté Jacques Aubé, vice-président exécutif et directeur général, evenko.

Partenaire financier de l’événement, Tourisme Montréal est fier de soutenir cette initiative qui contribuera au rayonnement de Montréal sur la scène du sport professionnel et réanimera la flamme des Montréalais pour le baseball.
 
Les amateurs de baseball pourront se procurer des billets dès le samedi 14 septembre sur le site evenko.ca. Ceux qui se procureront des billets pour les deux rencontres profiteront d’un rabais de 10 %. Des prix spéciaux pour enfants sont également disponibles.

------

After a 10 year absence, major league baseball returns to Montreal!

METS vs. BLUE JAYS  
Two-game series  / Olympic Stadium
Friday, March 28, 2014 at 7:05pm
Saturday, March 29, 2014 at 1:05pm

TICKETS ON SALE SATURDAY, SEPTEMBER 14 AT 10AM

Tickets on sale at the Olympic Stadium box office
By phone:  1 855 790-1245
Order online: www.evenko.ca
Ticket prices:  $18/ $28/ $43/ $58/ $83 (taxes and service fees included)
* Special packages and children rates also available

evenko is proud to present a two-game series between the Toronto Blue Jays and the New York Mets on March 28-29, 2014 at Olympic Stadium. 
The Toronto franchise, under the direction of Montreal-born general manager and former Expos member Alex Anthopoulos, will host its New York counterparts in preparation for Major League Baseball’s 145th season. The series, featuring the American League Toronto Blue Jays and the National League Mets, will give Montreal baseball fans an opportunity to reconnect with Major League Baseball and to see several of the best Major League Baseball players in action, including power hitters Edwin Encarnacion, José Bautista and José Reyes, as well as pitcher R.A. Dickey and outstanding Canadian infielder Brett Lawrie.
 
“We are excited to bring the Blue Jays to Montreal play in Montreal and give the fans a taste of Major League Baseball again. This will be a very meaningful experience knowing the strength and passion of baseball fans in Quebec. We hope that these games will rekindle their interest in the Blue Jays and Major League Baseball,” said Paul Beeston, Toronto Blue Jays President and CEO.
 
This will not  be the first series of games between the two teams. Between 1997 and 2012, since the beginning of interleague games, both teams have faced each other on 21 occasions; 12 times  in Toronto and nine times on the Mets’ home field. The Mets, which are well known to Montreal baseball fans, won 15 games,  and lost six. On Canadian soil, the two teams each have a record of six wins and six losses. The last game between the Jays and the Mets goes back to May 20, 2012, when the Mets won 6-5, at Rogers Centre.
 
“Being from Montreal personally, this is going to be a great thrill. I started my career with the Expos and spent many a game at Olympic Stadium. It will be exciting to see the Big O come to life again with Major League Baseball,” said Alex Anthopoulos, Toronto Blue Jays Senior Vice-President and General Manager.
  
As part of this Major League Baseball event in Montreal, Baseball Québec will be directly involved with specialists on site to offer baseball clinics on the field on Sunday, March 30. To promote the development of the sport among young people throughout the province, Baseball Québec will participate in many initiatives and programs that will be put forward as part of this two-game series at Olympic Stadium.

“After more than a decade without Major League Baseball in Montreal, we are proud to welcome this special baseball event  between two leading teams. We are also pleased to provide Quebec fans with exciting baseball while contributing to the growth and development of the sport, thanks to the involvement of Baseball Québec,” added Jacques Aubé, evenko Executive Vice-President and General Manager.

As a financial partner of the event, Tourisme Montréal is proud to support this initiative, which will help showcase the Montréal professional sports scene and revive the passion Montrealers have for baseball.
 
Baseball fans will be able to buy tickets starting September 14 at 10 a.m. on evenko.ca. Those who purchase tickets for both games will get a 10% discount. Special prices for children are also available.

207731619431427.description:
2 DAYS OF EVENTS IN MONTREAL! 
WORKSHOPS: THURSDAY APRIL 3RD @ CONCORDIA
LIVE SHOW: APRIL 4TH @ THE NOMAD
RSVP: FREE [DETAILS BELOW]

--------------------------

THE GROUCHO FRACTAL SHOW  + 2 ECO-TECH WORKSHOPS

The presentation and workshops will be hosted by artist and inventor Scott Beibin.

--------------------------

THE GROUCHO FRACTAL SHOW (LIVE!)
129 Van Horne, Montréal, QC H2T 2J2
Friday, April 4th
7pm to 9pm
Tickets: We will begin distribution Monday, March 31st!

Groucho Fractal’s Nearly Amazing Quantum Transdimensional Eco-Tech Survival Guide at the End (and Beginning) of Everything is a spectacle featuring a veritable bevy of new ideas. It explores the intersection of science, consciousness, art, nature, and focus/meditation techniques. 

The interactive show features a recursive self-contained miniature closed-grid ecosystem featuring a bicycle powered electrical generator, brain computer interface device, and the SourcerBot, a self replicating environmentally friendly 3D food printer which creates snacks by using audience members brainwaves. 

The show invites us to dig deeply into the tangled and complex relationships between power and energy (both electrical and political) while approaching a future filled with decentralized systems built upon the scaled-up philosophies of mutual aid, and environmental sustainability. 

During the performance, a semi-permanent autonomous zone is created in which to contemplate the myriad of ways in which emerging technologies may be incorporated into everyday life through a lens of celebration, caution and skepticism.

And yes, vegan snacks made from brainwaves.

Hosted by Scott Beibin

--------------------------

WORKSHOP: BUILD A SOURCERBOT 3D PRINTER 
Thursday, April 3rd
email Charles Bourassa [ cb659@me.com ] for details
Location: 7th floor of Hall Building at Concordia University
RSVP: http://bit.ly/1eutFuE

Learn to build an open source 3d printer. The first 5 hours of the workshop will be dedicated to building the SourcerBot 3d printer. The last 3 hours are dedicated to basic 3d design modeling and 3d printing. Attendees will also learn basic 3D computer aided design modeling using free and open-source software. Snacks will be offered throughout the workshop.

Hosted by Scott Beibin with a videochat by co-inventor Azi Mandias.

--------------------------

WORKSHOP: BUILD A BIKE GENERATOR 
Thursday, April 3rd
email Charles Bourassa [ cb659@me.com ] for details
Location: 7th floor of Hall Building at Concordia University
RSVP: http://bit.ly/LBMqPL

Learn to build a bike generator. The first hour of the workshop will be an overview of the technology behind the bike powered generator. The last four hours will be dedicated to building the generator. Snacks will be offered throughout the workshop.

Hosted by Scott Beibin with a videochat by a surprise guest.

--------------------------

TICKETS
Admission to all presentations are FREE
* Please note workshop space is limited. RSVP with the above links if you're interested in attending.

SPONSORS
In collaboration with the Sustainability Action Fund, Arts & Science Federation of Associations, and Concordia Student Union.

QUESTIONS
Please forward questions to project leader Charles Bourassa via Facebook or email at cb659@me.com
